document_data.name: Spectral Stag
document_data.mainbody: '''''Spectral stag''''' was an [[illusion]] [[spell]] that conjured a spectral [[stag]] that charged from the caster for a short duration.
document_data.Effects:
The ''stag'' appeared as a smoky apparition with glowing red eyes. It rushed from the caster in a straight line, for a length of {{SI|90|ft|long=yes}}, goring persons or creatures along the way. The path of the ''stag's'' charge remained on a flat plane, bypassing any chasms or pits.

The ''spectral stag'' could be ''[[Dispel magic|dispelled]]'' and destroyed by ''[[antimagic field]]s''.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required a hoof, antler, or bone taken from a naturally living [[deer]].
document_data.History: The specifications of this spell were outlined in the [[Malar]]ite [[relic]], the ''[[Book of Fangs and Talons]]''.
